question: Which of the following statements about the Gandhara School of Art is NOT correct?
option1: It displays Greek artistic influence and the concept of the “man-god” was essentially inspired by Greek mythological culture.
option2: Gandhara School of art enjoyed the liberal patronage of Indo-Greek rulers.
option3: Artistically, the Gandharan school of sculpture is said to have contributed wavy hair, drapery covering both shoulders, shoes and sandals etc.
option4: The Gandhara art primarily depicted the Buddhist themes.
answer: Gandhara School of art enjoyed the liberal patronage of Indo-Greek rulers.
explanation: Gandhara School of art enjoyed the liberal patronage of Kushana rulers especially Kanishka. The Gandhara art primarily depicted the Buddhist themes. It displays Greek artistic influence and the concept of the “man-god” was essentially inspired by Greek mythological culture. Artistically, the Gandharan school of sculpture is said to have contributed wavy hair, drapery covering both shoulders, shoes and sandals etc.
